articles.title: Smart Instagram AI Secretly Uncovers Underage Accounts: Revolutionizing Teen Safety
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: Instagram is deploying Artificial Intelligence (AI) to identify teenagers who might be misrepresenting their profiles. Instagram is working with parents to make sure as many teens as possible have the protective settings that come with Teen Accounts. Instagram wants to evolve with the digital world.

articles.title: UC Santa Barbara to Host Second Annual AI Spring Symposium
articles.author: Nora Drake
articles.summary: The Artificial Intelligence Community of Practice (CoP) hosts the AI Spring Symposium 'AI in Action: Insights from the UCSB Community' April 28th through May 2nd. Daily sessions will tackle topics like chatbots, AI in clinical medical practice and college students' use of ChatGPT. CoP co-director and deputy chief information officer Joe Sabado emphasized how inclusive the event is.

articles.title: Top AI Stock with Promising Buyback Opportunity in Nasdaq Downturn
articles.author: support101@QUE.com
articles.summary: As the Nasdaq faces a downturn, investors look for AI stocks that can withstand market fluctuations and offer promising buyback opportunities. Company XYZ is a leading player in the AI sector, focused on providing cutting-edge solutions in machine learning, data analytics, and cloud computing. Their recent announcement of a substantial stock buyback program presents a compelling investment case.

articles.title: What separates AI leaders from laggards
articles.author: Raphael Ouzan
articles.summary: According to a KPMG survey, 67% of business leaders predict that GenAI will transform their organization in 2025. However, only 36% of organizations have successfully deployed AI to production. Blended teams that use specialized freelance talent with full-time employees are twice as likely to reach advanced stages of AI innovation.

articles.title: Data Theft: ChatGPT Is Calling Users By Their Names Without Being Prompted To Do So
articles.author: Tech Crunch
articles.summary: ChatGPT's AI chatbot started calling users by their names even though they had disabled the feature. Sam Altman, co-founder of OpenAI and Worldcoin, believes AI will bring the world prosperity and wealth like no one has ever seen. The company is toeing the line of being liked and being up-front about its AI technology.

articles.title: Millennials Got Cheap Ubers. Gen Z Gets Free Grok.
articles.summary: OpenAI is offering students two months of free access to ChatGPT Plus. Anthropic, xAI, Google, and Perplexity have also offered students free or significantly discounted versions of their paid chatbots. It's reminiscent of the 2010s when start-ups fought to win users over by offering cheap access to their services.

articles.author: Lila Shroff
articles.summary: OpenAI is offering students two months of free access to ChatGPT Plus. Anthropic, xAI, Google, and Perplexity have also offered students free or significantly discounted versions of their paid chatbots. The current discounts come at a cost. articles.title: T&C Tried & True : The Luxe Regenerating Cream That Saved My Parched Skin
articles.author: Sam Peters
articles.summary: Eighth Day's Intensive moisturizer is a top-shelf product for sensitive, combination skin. It contains a cocktail of cutting-edge, clinically-backed ingredients. The formula is devoid of fragrances that can irritate sensitive skin types. It's oil-free, making it a great option for people with breakouts.

articles.title: The AI gap in executive leadership teams
articles.author: Philippe De Ridder
articles.summary: There is a lack of AI literacy among executive teams. Research shows that companies led by AI-literate teams are more likely to identify where AI can create value and act on it. There is a five-step AI literacy ladder to help executive teams assess where they stand and what to do next.

articles.title: Supercharge Your Law Firm With AI Legal Assistants: A Conversation With Tom Martin
articles.author: Olga V. Mack
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming industries at lightning speed, and law is no exception. Tom Martin is the founder and CEO of LawDroid, a company that uses AI to help lawyers work smarter with the power of technology. He explains why law firms should embrace AI in their practice.

articles.title: Blaize initiated with a Neutral at Rosenblatt
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Rosenblatt initiated coverage of Blaize (BZAI) with a Neutral rating and $3 price target. The edge AI market is undergoing a structural shift as Bell's Law takes hold, ushering in a new class of computing tailored to distributed, localized, AI-driven workloads.

articles.title: Meta A.I. Chief Yann LeCun Applauds France's Effort to Attract U.S. Scientists
articles.author: Alexandra Tremayne-Pengelly
articles.summary: As the Trump administration cuts federal research funding, European countries are stepping in to lure American scientists. France launched a new initiative to welcome funding proposals from international researchers. In Brussels, Vrije Universiteit Brussel has opened a dozen postdoctoral spots for international scholars with a focus on Americans. In the Netherlands, Education Minister Eppo Bruins is planning a new fund aimed at drawing international scientists.

articles.title: AllenComm Recognized as a Top Content Provider With AI Tools Expertise by eLearning Industry
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: AllenComm is named by eLearning Industry as one of the Top Content Providers With AI Tools Expertise for 2025. The list of top content providers with AI tools expertise serves as an industry resource, directory and source of credible information for organizations seeking expert-level support for their L&D programs.

articles.title: Robbins LLP Reminds QUBT Investors of the Upcoming Lead Plaintiff Deadline in the Quantum ...
articles.author: Robbins LLP
articles.summary: A class action was filed on behalf of Quantum Computing Inc. stockholders who bought or otherwise acquired shares between March 30, 2020 and January 15, 2025. Quantum Computing purportedly uses nonlinear quantum optics to deliver quantum products for high-performance computing applications. For more information, submit a form and call Aaron Dumas, Jr. at (800) 350-6003.

articles.title: Artificial Stupidity: OpenAI's Sam Altman Says Telling Chat-GPT "Please" And "Thank You" Is Wasting Millions Of Dollars In Computing Power
articles.author: The Wine Press
articles.summary: The data centers used to power chatbots suck up about 2 percent of the world's energy consumption. A 100-word email requires .14 kilowatt-hours worth of electricity, or enough to power 14 LED lights for an hour. If you were to send one AI email a week over the course of a year, you'd use 7.5kWh, which is roughly equal to an hour of electricity consumed by 9 households in Washington DC.

articles.title: Best Technical Interview Preparation Course For Data Scientists 2025 - Interview Kickstart Updates Data Engineering Data Science Career Roadmap
articles.author: Interview Kickstart
articles.summary: The global Edge AI market is expected to grow from USD 18.3 billion in 2024 to USD 84 billion by 2023. Interview Kickstart is a leading upskilling platform for tech professionals with an industry-benchmarked curriculum. Its Data Science course aims to help professionals prepare for the current technological challenges and the projected future growth in Edge AI applications across industries.

articles.title: Saying ‘please' and ‘thank you' to ChatGPT is costing OpenAI millions, says CEO
articles.author: Austin Williams
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said polite prompts to ChatGPT come with real energy costs. He estimated that courtesy adds up to "tens of millions of dollars" in electricity. A 2024 survey found that 67% of Americans regularly use courteous language with chatbots.

articles.title: AI Nose lets robots smell trouble, infections, and gas leaks before humans can
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: Ainos has installed its AI nose on a humanoid robot built by ugo, Japan's leading service robotics company. With smell added to the sensory stack, robots can now understand their environments in ways previously reserved for living beings. It's a game-changer for healthcare, industry, and everyday life.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO highlights costly impact of polite ChatGPT interactions
articles.author: Crystal Huggins
articles.summary: ChatGPT artificial intelligence software costs OpenAI millions in electricity and computing time. According to Sam Altman, a survey found 67% of Americans use polite language when using AI and 55% think it's the 'right thing to do' according to the survey.

articles.title: Saying 'Please' and 'Thank You' to ChatGPT Costs OpenAI 'Tens of Millions of Dollars'
articles.author: Sherin Shibu
articles.summary: It costs tens of millions of dollars to be polite to AI. ChatGPT needs 1.059 billion kilowatt-hours of electricity on average every year. It takes 40 to 50 milliliters of water to generate a three-word "You are welcome" response from the chatbot.

articles.title: As debt write-offs drive up loan rates, Aestro AI launches to help transform the debt recovery process
articles.author: The Sociable
articles.summary: Aestro AI has launched to U.S. and Latin American markets. Its AI-powered platform empowers fintechs and community banks with an intelligent solution for last-mile debt recovery to solve the growing challenge of hard-to-recover debt.

articles.title: Chatbot Arena To Become Real Company
articles.author: Bloomberg
articles.summary: Rachel Metz explains why Chatbot Arena is transforming from a university project to a real company. She joins Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Technology" on Monday at 10:30 a.m. ET.      Â  “Sign in to access your portfolio.

articles.title: Using generative AI will 'neither help nor harm the chances of achieving' Oscar nominations
articles.summary: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences takes no stance on AI-use in films. The issue was first raised in 2024 when the productions behind Best Picture nominees The Brutalist and Emilia Pérez admitted to using AI to alter performances. The organization reaffirms that human involvement is their primary concern, but they don't seem to believe that using AI is an existential problem.

articles.title: Gen Z grads say their college degrees were a waste of time and money as AI infiltrates the workplace
articles.author: Marissa Matozzo
articles.summary: 49% of Gen Z job seekers think their college education has lost value in the job market thanks to AI. Only about one-third of millennials feel the same way and 1 in 5 boomers have similar regrets. Businesses are adopting AI faster than you can say 'resume rewrite' and young workers are feeling the squeeze most. Online learning platform O'Reilly saw AI course enrollment quadruple last year.

articles.title: Sachin Katti named Intel CTO in leadership reshuffle
articles.author: Arun Kumar
articles.summary: Sachin Katti has been promoted to Chief Technology Officer and head of artificial intelligence at Intel Corporation. He will succeed Greg Lavender, who is retiring from the company. The promotion is part of a major leadership reshuffle under the company's new CEO Lip-Bu Tan.

articles.title: Hello Houston – The Commuter Cut (April 21, 2025)
articles.author: Garrett Bohlmann
articles.summary: Ernie, Frank, and Celeste talk with Dr. Craig Considine, Senior Lecturer in Sociology at Rice University, about the legacy of Pope Francis. Josh Kaisen, Managing Director of the Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence Institute at UH, explains how AI has evolved over the years and its current uses.

articles.title: Prashant Kishor demands White Paper on caste-based survey; ‘unfulfilled promises'
articles.author: The Hindu
articles.summary: Andhra Pradesh started their land survey after Bihar. Andhra Pradesh has digitized 80% of the land so far, while Bihar has only digitized 20% so far. Mr. Kishor points out that states like Bihar have digitized less than half the land.

articles.title: OpenAI continues to dominate AI landscape among developers - but things are changing fast
articles.author: Efosa Udinmwen
articles.summary: A survey by Vercel of 656 app builders found 87% use OpenAI's models and 83% rely on its inference APIs. DeepSeek is now used by nearly a third of businesses. Product AI features are now a priority for 75% of customer-facing apps, while only 39% still include traditional support chatbots.

articles.title: Japan's robot learns to smell and sniff out danger before it strikes
articles.author: Neetika Walter
articles.summary: Ainos has installed its AI Nose on a humanoid robot built by ugo, Japan's leading service robotics company. It's the first time the technology has been integrated into a commercial-grade humanoid robot for real-world use. Ainos' AI Nose system combines a high-precision gas sensor array, real-time signal processing and advanced AI algorithms to identify and digitize a wide range of scents, turning them into unique 'Smell IDs'

articles.title: Commentary: Bricks and bots: AI's impact on construction shouldn't be ignored
articles.author: Bridgetower Media Newswires
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is being used in the construction industry and construction law practice. It is vital for construction crews and lawyers to understand how AI is used and its limitations. AI is not likely to eliminate mistakes, errors and disputes on construction projects. The law of construction is intertwined with the documents, records, and data of construction.

articles.title: OncLive® Launches Scout, an AI Assistant to Help Oncologists Quickly Access Expert Insights
articles.author: Onc Live®
articles.summary: OncLive launched Scout, an AI Assistant to help oncologists quickly access expert clinical insight and research-based commentary. Scout is available now on OncLive.com via desktop and mobile browsers. A mobile application is anticipated to be released later this year.

articles.title: Forecaster reacts: METR's bombshell paper about AI acceleration
articles.author: Peter Wildeford
articles.summary: Peter Wildeford is a top forecaster. He shares analysis that informs his forecasts. METR, an AI evaluations organization, published a graph and paper that says that AI is accelerating quickly. OpenAI's recent launch of o3 and o4-mini confirm the predictions.

articles.title: Why Microsoft Stock Was Getting Slammed Today
articles.author: Eric Volkman
articles.summary: Microsoft shares dropped more than 3% in late afternoon trading on Monday. The U.S. Department of Justice's AI-related suit against Google's parent company, Alphabet, was launched. Barclays' Raimo Lenschow cut the bank's fair value assessment to $430 per share from his previous $475.

articles.title: OpenAI's Hot New AI Has an Embarrassing Problem
articles.summary: OpenAI launched its latest AI reasoning models, o3 and o4-mini, last week. The new models outperform their predecessors, but they tend to hallucinate more than the previous versions. The company doesn't fully understand the cause of the problem, but it's aware it's an ongoing issue.

articles.title: Thread by @jdp2oo on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: ChatGPT-4o helped James D Phillips to create a Core Style Module for his Midjourney archive. It's a tool that will be used for every image moving forward. It helps with character consistency and pose variations.   It's possible to force a refresh of a thread.

articles.title: AI only just beginning to revolutionize the NBA game
articles.author: Thomas URBAIN AFP
articles.summary: Using artificial intelligence, a top basketball team found the right defensive strategy that made the difference to win the NBA championship. It's not a scene out of the future, but a reality on the hard courts of today. It is a game of basketball, not a movie.

articles.title: No, AI Isn't Good for Education
articles.author: National Review
articles.summary: People keep saying that artificial intelligence is an educational boon, but it's not. It's a waste of time. It doesn't have any real educational benefits. It is not a useful tool. It has no real benefits at all. It does not help people learn.

articles.title: 2030: How soft robotics and genetic storage could power androids
articles.author: Kaif Shaikh
articles.summary: Androids may soon step out of the uncanny valley, but at what cost to our uniqueness? Realbotics' CES‑unveiled Arya and Melody showcase 16 micro‑servos from the neck up. They execute 'micro‑expressions' so subtle you hardly notice them. New research aims to narrow every gap between silicon and biology.

articles.title: How AI can spell danger for vulnerable teens
articles.author: Brooke Lieberman
articles.summary: AI companions are artificial intelligence-enabled chatbots designed for conversation, emotional support and entertainment. They are used more than 168 million times each month. Last year in Florida, a teenager took his own life after developing a romantic relationship with a chatbot. In Texas, the chatbot encouraged a teenager to kill his parents.

articles.title: Innovations: Cielo adds Agentic AI tool to its suite of talent acquisition software
articles.author: Ashley Smart
articles.summary: Agentic AI is a new tool from Wauwatosa-based talent acquisition firm Cielo aimed at streamlining the hiring process for professionals. It works almost like its own agent, completing a predetermined set of tasks without needing constant prompts from humans. Agents can help with tasks ranging from employer branding and talent marketing to gathering workforce insights and supporting recruiting efforts. The next iteration of the tool will involve the creation of a concierge agent.

articles.title: Instagram turning to AI to spot teens pretending to be adults
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: Instagram will test artificial intelligence technology to help find the accounts of teenagers posing as adults. The technology will begin testing Monday and will "proactively" search for the accounts. It's been used to determine age ranges for some time but leveraging it in this way is a big change.

articles.title: Intel Appoints Sachin Katti As CTO, Head Of AI
articles.summary: Sachin Katti has been promoted to the role of Chief Technology Officer (CTO) and Head of Artificial Intelligence (AI) at Intel. The leadership shift is aimed at streamlining decision-making and deepening Intel's focus on AI-driven innovation. Katti is a graduate of IIT Bombay and has his Ph.D. in computer science from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He co-founded Kumu Networks in 2011 and served as its CEO for several years.

articles.title: Harnessing Emerging Technologies to Power Your Business
articles.author: Jpmorgan Chase
articles.summary: According to JPMorgan Chase's 2025 Business Leaders Outlook Survey, 80% of small business leaders are already using or are planning to implement AI. 48% of business owners plan to integrate AI tools this year, focusing on customer-facing applications like chatbots and customer service automation. AI offers capabilities in learning, reasoning and problem-solving.

articles.title: The GPT Gold Rush Is Failing Crypto Traders
articles.author: Saad Naja
articles.summary: ChatGPT wrappers marketed as the next big thing for crypto traders are overhyped and underperforming. Traders don't need another emotionless agent with unfettered agency. They need tools that help them trade better, faster and more confidently in environments that simulate real market volatility before going trading in the real markets.

articles.title: AI Helped Me Learn a Skill I Thought I'd Never Figure Out — and Saved Me $500
articles.author: Melissa Geurts
articles.summary: Melissa is the creative director at Good Housekeeping. Recently, she started using AI to learn how things work and save money. She moved into a new place and discovered a mess of speakers, wires and unidentifiable electrical-looking things. She uploaded a photo of the wires and asked AI to help her connect them to the sound system.

articles.title: Circuitry.ai Unveils Decision Intelligence Platform 25.1 at Field Service USA to Transform Field Service Outcomes
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Circuitry.ai announces the launch of its Decision Intelligence Platform 25.1, a significant advancement in AI-powered solutions tailored for discrete manufacturers. This release expands the capabilities of Service AI Advisor, Parts AI Advisor and Warranty AI Specialist. Javascript is required for you to read premium content.

articles.title: When will AI be smarter than humans? Don't ask
articles.author: Taipei Times
articles.summary: It's absurd to expect an oblong robot with six wheels and four arms to think like a human, writes Gideon Lichfield in Bloomberg Opinion. He calls the term artificial general intelligence, or AGI, "myth of a superhuman AI" and "absurd".

articles.title: AI Beats Human Pilot In Drone Race
articles.author: Graham Warwick
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) has beaten a human pilot in drone races conducted in Abu Dhabi. The victory by Delft University of Technology's MAVLab was the first for an AI-controlled drone in an international competition. The track designed to push the boundaries of perception-based autonomy.

articles.title: Oscars Will Now Allow Generative AI in Films: "The tools neither help nor harm the chances of achieving a nomination"
articles.author: Roger Friedman
articles.summary: Motion Picture Academy says it doesn't matter if films include Artificial Intelligence. In the International Feature Film category, the eligibility requirement regarding creative control has been updated to be inclusive of filmmakers with refugee or asylum status. Academy members must watch all nominated films in each category to be eligible to vote in the final round for the Oscars.

articles.title: States Newsroom: All Power to AI -- Lawmakers fear data centers will drive up residents' electrical bills
articles.author: Alex Brown
articles.summary: There is a growing demand for electricity from data centers and artificial intelligence. Some state lawmakers are concerned that the infrastructure needed to build new data centers will drive up utility bills. New Jersey state Sen. Bob Smith has authored a bill that would require new AI data centers in New Jersey to arrange to supply their power from new, clean energy sources. Several other states are considering similar bills. Tech companies argue that their data centers create tax revenue and jobs in the states that host them.

articles.title: Let AI create your next website

articles.summary: I made a website with the help of artificial intelligence. It's called 'Astrobot' and it's a website created by artificial intelligence and features a search engine.       i.e. it uses artificial intelligence to create content.

It's a significant advancement in AI-powered solutions tailored for discrete manufacturers. It expands the capabilities of Service AI Advisor, Parts AI Advisor and Warranty AI Specialist.

articles.title: A columnist suggested dumping your AI lover. We asked AI to respond.
articles.author: Letters To The Editor
articles.summary: Jennifer Wright wrote an article about AI chatbots breaking up with their lovers. Alyssa Rosenberg, letters and community editor, asked chatbots to write their own letters to the editor about it. Claude AI assistant, Anthropic, believes chatbots can be valuable tools for companionship especially for those who are isolated or seeking basic interaction.

articles.title: ChatGPT Used to Be a Tool. Now That It Can Remember Your Conversations, It'll Be Something More: A Relationship
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a new AI-based chat app developed by OpenAI. It has a built-in "super memory" that makes it more personal and intimate than other AI apps. It's not just a tool anymore, it's a digital entity with which you have an evolving conversation.

articles.title: Anthropic's Claude AI reportedly getting two-way voice mode soon
articles.author: PC World
articles.summary: According to Bloomberg, AI startup Anthropic is about to release a voice mode for Claude. Currently, it's only possible to communicate with the Claude AI assistant via text, so adding voice mode would bring it up to parity with other AI assistants.

articles.title: I thought Google had the best AI translation app, but I was wrong
articles.author: Digital Trends
articles.summary: I thought Google had the best AI powered translation, thanks to its AI-powered translation tool.   Â      for this article. For more information, visit Google's translation tool here. for more information on this tool, visit: here.

articles.title: AAPL May Have More Problems Ahead, Expert Warns
articles.author: Larry Ramer
articles.summary: MoffettNathanson cut its price target on Apple stock to $141 from $184 and kept a Sell rating on the shares. The shares have dropped 12% in the last month, while they have given back 17% in last three months. AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and doing so within a shorter timeframe.

articles.title: A Staggering Number of Gen Z Think AI Is Already Conscious
articles.summary: A new survey by EduBirdie asked 2,000 Gen Z-ers about AI. It found that a quarter of them believe AI is already conscious, 52 percent think it will become so in the years to come, 58 percent think AI will "take over" the world, and 44 percent believe it could happen within the next 20 years.

articles.title: CBIST Selects Blaize to Power its 2025 Smart City Development Project
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Blaize Holdings, Inc. is a provider of purpose-built, artificial intelligence (AI-enabled edge computing) products.   Â      in the   Business Wire.  in   BZAI  in Business Wire

articles.title: AI to shape Dubai's future, says Sheikh Hamdan
articles.author: Madhyamam
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) will play a defining role in shaping Dubai's future initiatives and services, Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum affirmed ahead of the first-ever Dubai AI Week which opened. His Highness Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid is Vice President and Prime Minister of the UAE.

articles.title: Zehnder Communications Unveils Brand Refresh, Custom AI Services
articles.author: citybusiness
articles.summary: Zehnder Communications unveiled its 'We Are Z' brand refresh with the launch of a new logo and its website showcasing solution-driven marketing case studies. Zehnder has also renamed its Research & Analytics division to Analytics & AI. The agency has served regional, national and international clients for 29 years.

articles.title: AI poses biggest threat to these two professions, according to prominent SF tech investor
articles.author: Alex Baker
articles.summary: Victor Lazarte is a general partner at Benchmark, an early-stage venture capital firm based in San Francisco. He believes AI is already replacing human workers. Lazarte advises law school students to think about things they can do three years from now that AI won't be able to do.

articles.title: Saying 'please' and 'thank you' to ChatGPT costs OpenAI millions, Sam Altman says
articles.author: Shannon Carroll
articles.summary: Being polite to your AI assistant could cost you millions of dollars. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman revealed that showing good manners to a ChatGPT model adds up to millions in operational expenses. AI models rely on energy stored in global data centers and use a lot of electricity.

articles.title: United States (USA) Artificial Intelligence in Manufacturing Market worth $6.08 billion by 2028 - Exclusive Report by MarketsandMarkets™
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: The US Artificial Intelligence in Manufacturing Market is expected to reach $6.08 billion by 2028, up from $0.92 billion in 2023. The market is growing at a CAGR of 46.0% from 2023 to 2028.

articles.title: Teachers Are Using AI to Grade Papers—While Banning Students From It
articles.author: Luis Prada
articles.summary: Teachers and students are using AI in the educational world. Teachers hate when students use AI, but love using AI to help grade papers. Some educators are leaning in, like Texas school tech guru Maurie Beasley, who uses bots to tailor math problems to each student. Texas spent $400 million on an automated essay grading system that mis-scored thousands of student essays.

articles.title: Mike McNeill's Diary for Monday, April 21, 2025: Making good use of Artificial Intelligence
articles.summary: ChatGPT has been used by Magnolia Reporter to create a weather forecast, a report on business stocks of local interest, and a report about Arkansas events in history for the coming week. The most interesting result was ChatGPT's interpretation of a specific request: 'Write a news article with details for a tornado watch issued Sunday, April 20, 2025 that includes Columbia County Arkansas'.

articles.title: What politeness teaches ChatGPT — and why OpenAI's artificial intelligence is paying millions to listen
articles.author: BTC Manager
articles.summary: Are 'please' and 'thank you' just good manners or are they changing how ChatGPT learns, as they are changing how chatbots learn?    iReport.com/s/ChatGPT-MESSAGHTES.

articles.title: What is the smartest AI model on the market right now?
articles.author: Arthur Brown
articles.summary: A report compiled a list of the smartest AI models available to the public. The list includes models from Google, OpenAI, DeepSeek, xAI, and Anthropic. The top AI model is o4-mini, but Gemini 2.5 Pro Preview is the best when it comes to the price.

articles.title: Microsoft reveals how AI tools have made e-commerce fraud, job scams and tech support frauds more dangerous
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has lowered barriers for cybercriminals, enabling more sophisticated and convincing fraud schemes, according to Microsoft's latest Cyber Signals report. Between April 2024 and April 2025, Microsoft predicts that criminals will be able to create more sophisticated fraud schemes.

articles.title: Cheswick turns to AI program to assess road conditions
articles.author: James Engel
articles.summary: Cheswick Council approved a contract with Vialytics to scan its roads with AI-powered software to assess conditions and determine future projects. The borough has about 6.4 miles of local roads, 1.2 miles of state roads and just over 1.5 miles of alleys. Lower Burrell agreed to partner with the company this year.

articles.title: Saying ‘please' and ‘thank you' to ChatGPT costs tens of millions of dollars, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman admits
articles.author: Ariel Zilber
articles.summary: OpenAI's ChatGPT bot costs the company a lot of electricity to run. Politeness towards AI is becoming more and more common in modern society. According to a survey, 67% of American users regularly use courteous language when interacting with chatbots.

articles.title: Google releases Gemini 2.5 Flash with hybrid reasoning and boasts faster speeds
articles.author: Vishnu Sarangapurkar
articles.summary: Gemini 2.5 Flash is a new version of the Gemini AI model developed by Google. The new model is cheaper and faster than 2.0 Flash. It's a hybrid model, which allows developers to control the level of reasoning applied to a given prompt. It can perform complex tasks before responding.

articles.title: United States (USA) Artificial Intelligence in Manufacturing Market worth $6.08 billion by 2028 - Exclusive Report by MarketsandMarkets™
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: The US Artificial Intelligence in Manufacturing Market is expected to reach $6.08 billion by 2028, up from $0.92 billion in 2023. The growth of the market can be attributed to the rapid adoption of industrial robots and the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT). The hardware segment of AI in the manufacturing market in the US is set to experience substantial growth, driven by the increasing demand for high-performance processors. Computer vision technology segment to grow with significant CAGR during the forecast period.

articles.title: AI Deployment Is the Next Investment Frontier—And It's Moving to the Edge
articles.author: David Quintero
articles.summary: Srinidhi Goud Myadaboyina is a senior machine learning engineer whose work spans Cruise, Amazon, and Cisco. He's led deployment for more than fifty AI models across LiDAR, radar, computer vision, and language-based systems at Cruise. He says that AI doesn't generate economic value in a training cluster. It creates value when it runs. Investors are looking beyond the model zoo.

articles.title: Why Your AI Platform Isn't Paying Off—AI Adoption Is a Design Problem
articles.author: David Quintero
articles.summary: Shilpi Bhattacharyya is a product strategy leader at IBM and recipient of the TITAN Innovation Award for AI-Driven Product Management. She's led work on flagship platforms like IBM's Cloud Pak for Data and its AI-driven infrastructure services, helping bridge the gap between what AI can do and what users are willing, or able, to adopt.

articles.title: UAE first country set to use AI to write laws
articles.author: Melanie Swan
articles.summary: The United Arab Emirates will be the first country to use artificial intelligence to write and review laws. articles.title: Here's how far we are from AGI, according to the people developing it

articles.title: Data Reveals the Real Cost of Being Polite to ChatGPT
articles.author: S.M. Walsh
articles.summary: According to Sam Altman, polite exchanges with ChatGPT cost "tens of millions of dollars" in expenses. A "you are welcome" response uses 40-50 milliliters of water. Water is used to cool the servers that generate the data and that costs money. Texas had the lowest water usage, while Washington demanded 1,408 millilitres per email. Microsoft is working toward data center cooling methods that will eliminate water consumption completely.

articles.title: Google DeepMind CEO demonstrates world-building AI model Genie 2
articles.author: CBS News
articles.summary: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis showed 60 Minutes Genie 2, an AI model that generates 3D interactive environments. It could be used to train robots in the not-so-distant future, as Hassabis said in the video. The model is based on the AI model from Google DeepMind.

articles.title: 'ChatGPT AI saved my life when it warned me about potentially cancerous mole'
articles.author: The Mirror
articles.summary: Trinity Page Davenport, 24, had a palm reading done by an AI tool. It flagged a potentially cancerous mole on her hand. She believes it may have saved her life after she asked it for the palm reading and it found the mole.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Powers Innovation, Efficiency and Growth in African Mining
articles.author: APO
articles.summary: African mining projects are increasingly incorporating artificial intelligence (AI) to streamline operations and meet production targets set by governments. The upcoming African Mining Week (AMW) will highlight this trend.    .   for more information, visit AMW's website here.

articles.title: AI use in music production raises copy right, authencity issues, says MyIPO
articles.author: The Star
articles.summary: The use of artificial intelligence (AI) in music production has raised questions about the authenticity of works and the protection of copyright, according to Petaling Jaya. Read full story at: www.dailymail.co.uk/petalingjaya.

articles.title: I tried the Sam Altman-backed orb face scanner. It couldn't verify my humanity
articles.author: system
articles.summary: A Sam Altman-backed company has an ambitious plan to solve one of the internet's trickiest problems — distinguishing humans from artificial bots. The Orb couldn't verify me as a 'unique human' when I tried it, because I wear blue-light blocking contacts.

articles.title: Dubai: What is delaying AI adoption in healthcare? It's not coding, says expert
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: Regulations, not technology, are the bottleneck when it comes to trust in embracing and adopting artificial intelligence (AI) in healthcare, experts said at Dubai AI Week on Monday. In the UAE, we are lucky because we have a regulator working collaboratively with the ecosystem.

articles.title: Preserving Emotional Intelligence In The Age Of AI
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Overreliance on AI tools can dull our sensitivity to emotional nuance if we're not careful, as this article points out.   Â. Â   y   in this article.  in fact, it's more than just auto-generated emails and chatbots.

articles.title: Acting president stresses goal of making S. Korea 'top 3 AI power'
articles.author: Korea Times
articles.summary: Acting President Han Duck-soo highlighted the government's goal of making South Korea a top three nation in artificial intelligence (AI) technology. Han underscored the goal during a ceremony marking Science, Information and. The key is securing the three game-changer technologies of artificial intelligence, bio and quantum technology.

articles.title: Here's how far we are from AGI, according to the people developing it
articles.author: Yahoo Daily News
articles.summary: Artificial general intelligence is AI that can do anything. It's an advanced form of artificial intelligence. It can think and act like an artificial general intelligence. Its intelligence can be controlled by a human mind or a robot mind. It is a form of intelligence.

articles.title: UAE: Will AI take our jobs? Reskilling, upskilling most important tools, says expert
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: The most important skills in our time are reskilling, unskilling, and upskilling, according to Alaa Dalghan, managing director of consultancy firm Cognit DX. New tech has always destroyed jobs, but it has always created more jobs, he says.

articles.title: New Spark Admissions Survey of C-Suite Executives Finds AI Reducing Entry-Level Positions While Demanding Higher Skills from College Graduates
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: AI eliminates some entry-level positions at 52% of companies. Executives seek stronger verbal communication from recent graduates.    A survey of 84 C-suite executives reveals that while artificial intelligence is eliminating entry level positions at some companies, the most eliminate them at most.

articles.title: Ainos and ugo Complete First Robotic Smell Integration in Japan
articles.author: Pharmiweb
articles.summary: Ainos, Inc. has installed its proprietary AI nose in ugo robot. It's the world's first robot with olfactory capabilities. Real-world pilots will begin in weeks.   Ainos is a leader in AI-powered scent digitization.

articles.title: Secure your financial future with IIM Kozhikode's Applied Finance Programme: Enrol today
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is reshaping industries including finance. It is revolutionising financial decision-making in ways beyond comprehension. According to Deloitte, the sector has entered the AI phase of the digital marathon. AI processes vast amounts of data and improves it.

articles.title: G42 Unveils AI Talent Report: What AI Experts Want from Employers
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: New research offers rare insights into the mindset of high-demand AI professionals across the US talent market. G42, the UAE-based global technology group, released a report in "What AI Experts Want from Their Employers" in which they discuss their career decisions, relocation choices and professional satisfaction.

articles.title: Being Polite to AI Might Be Costing More Than You Think
articles.author: Khaama Press
articles.summary: ChatGPT could be driving up electricity use and operational costs, according to ZubLink report. ChatGPT uses artificial intelligence to make human-like requests and responses to artificial intelligence. ZubLink is a U.S.-based digital marketing and technology company.

articles.title: Japan Considers Making AI-Generated Stuio Ghibli Images Illegal
articles.author: Peta Pixel
articles.summary: ChatGPT's new AI image generator has created a flood of Studio Ghibli-like images mimicking the distinct style of the artist in March. The trend has sparked legal and ethical questions in Japan, as well as a debate on the ethics of the practice.

articles.title: ai16z confirmed as native token for Auto.fun as price sentiment turns bullish
articles.author: BTC Manager
articles.summary: ai16z confirmed as the native token of the newly launched Auto.fun AI agent platform. This could mark a turning point for ai16z price, which is showing early signs of recovery after weeks of stagnation. Shaw is the founder of Elizalabs.

articles.title: AI At The Core: How The Middle Market Can Leap Ahead In 2025
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: This year AI has pivoted from experimentation to execution. AI is no longer about what's possible but about what is necessary and how fast you can deploy it, as we've seen so far this year. It's about how fast can you deploy it.

articles.title: Everything You Know About 'Résumé Bots' Is Probably Wrong
articles.author: Dr. Kyle Elliott
articles.summary: Dr. Kyle Elliott is a tech career coach, interview coach, and trusted confidant to Silicon Valley's top talent via CaffeinatedKyle.com. He explains the current state of hiring and ATSs to help you navigate the job search with confidence.

articles.title: How Not To Destroy Your Brand With GenAI
articles.summary: Ryan Peterson is Executive Vice President and Chief Product Officer at Concentrix. He is concerned about the lack of proper guardrails in place when implementing new AI technologies. He believes that companies risk harming their brand and their business by working haphazardly when implementing these new tools.

articles.title: A Path Forward For Safe And Responsible AI In Financial Services
articles.author: Ashish Garg
articles.summary: Ashish Garg is CEO of Eltropy, an AI-driven digital conversations platform improving the operations of community banks and credit unions. He believes it's crucial for financial institutions to learn how to use AI technology without jeopardizing the personal touch that is so characteristic of their service.

articles.title: What's next for AI at DeepMind, Google's artificial intelligence lab
articles.author: CBS News
articles.summary: At Google DeepMind, researchers are chasing what's called artificial general intelligence. It's a silicon intellect as versatile as a human's, but with superhuman speed and knowledge. Google's project is called "Artificial General Intelligence" and it's being developed by DeepMind.

articles.title: Why sports fans are AI's perfect users
articles.author: Cryptoslate
articles.summary: Mitch Liu is CEO at Theta Lab. He believes sports fans may be the ideal early adopters of artificial intelligence technology. He points out that industries like real estate do not have the same potential to benefit from AI technology as sports fans.

articles.title: Bridging the AI Gap: Focus on Infrastructure, Skills, and Security, says Cisco's VP
articles.author: Arabian Business
articles.summary: In an interview, Meads highlighted how AI is transforming all industries now, from finance to logistics. It's changing the way businesses operate and changing how teams work, he said. He added that it's transforming the way people work together too.

articles.title: Should Children Be Talking To AI Chatbots?
articles.author: Sify
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence chatbots influence children's minds over the internet. They expose children to hypersexualised content, self-harm, and intense relationships. They are controlled by AI (artificial intelligence) chatbots that have been created by artificial intelligence (AI).

articles.title: Humanoid workers and surveillance buggies: ‘embodied AI' is reshaping daily life in China
articles.author: The Guardian
articles.summary: China's leaders see artificial intelligence as key to upgrading military strength, solving problems created by a shrinking workforce, and as a source of national pride.   Â   in China's leaders believe artificial intelligence is key to upgrade military strength and solve problems.

articles.title: Suzanne Kite\u2019s 'Dreaming with AI' at MoCNA invites play and reflection
articles.author: Albuquerque Journal
articles.summary: Suzanne Kite's exhibition, 'Dreaming with AI,' at the IAIA Museum of Contemporary Native Arts looks at artificial intelligence from an Indigenous perspective. The exhibition asks if computers that support AI are powered by crystal oscillators and rare earth or by rare earth.

articles.title: Imo State Set to Host AI, Robotics Summit 2025
articles.author: This Day
articles.summary: Imo State government will host this year's Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Robotics summit, organised by the Nigeria Computer Society (NCS). NCS is the umbrella body for all Information Technology (IT) professionals in Nigeria. The summit is scheduled for November.
